question:
Last Wednesday you flew from London to Vancouver. When you arrived home, you discovered that you had left your hand luggage on the plane.

Write a letter to the airline. In your letter, you should explain:

where and when you lost your bag
what your bag looks like
what its contents were
text: I am writing to report my lost suitcase was left on your flight CX123 last Wednesday 24 January 2019. The flight flew from London to Vancouver. I discovered that the hand luggage had been gone before check out. It was probably I forgot to take it back from the jet.

Please kindly help to spot out my luggage. Details of my lost property are stated as follows. It is a black lady handbag shown “GUESS” at the front and back. It is spacious with two gold buttons inside.

The handbag contained the following items: two packets of tissues, red and pink lipsticks, a foundation, a set of makeup brushes, perfume, a mirror, an eyeliner, a packet of eye shadow, umbrella, cap, sunglasses, a jacket, my son’s car toys, snacks and a watch.
Please do not hesitate to contact me by email or phone [email protected] / 8123123 if you have any clues.
I am looking forward for your reply.
